name: Epilepsy
description: A neurological disorder marked by sudden recurrent episodes of sensory disturbance, loss of consciousness, or convulsions, associated with abnormal electrical activity in the brain.

name: Hypoglycemia
description: A condition characterized by an abnormally low level of blood sugar (glucose), which is the body's main energy source.

name: Sleep Disorders
description: A group of conditions that affect the ability to sleep well on a regular basis, including insomnia, sleep apnea, and narcolepsy.

name: Muscle Strain
description: An injury to a muscle or tendon resulting from overstretching or overuse, leading to pain and limited movement.

name: Arthritis
description: A group of conditions involving inflammation of one or more joints, causing pain and stiffness that can worsen with age.

name: Dermatitis
description: A general term for inflammation of the skin, which can result from allergies or irritants.

name: Gastroenteritis
description: An intestinal infection marked by diarrhea, cramps, nausea, vomiting, and fever, often caused by bacteria or viruses.

name: Sciatica
description: Pain affecting the back, hip, and outer side of the leg, caused by compression of a spinal nerve root in the lower back.

name: Tendonitis
description: Inflammation or irritation of a tendon, often caused by repetitive motion or overuse.

name: Fibromyalgia
description: A chronic condition characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, and tenderness in localized areas.
